Complete the following questions to practice the skills you have learned in this lesson.

  1. The graphs show the distance, \(d\), traveled by two cars, A and B, over time, \(t\). Distance is measured in miles, and time is measured in hours. Which car traveled slower?

Correct! Car A traveled slower because Car B was a farther distance in the same amount of time as Car A.

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 4.9.1–4.9.4. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is Car A traveled slower because Car B was a farther distance in the same amount of time as Car A.

For questions 2–5, use the graphs below to match each description of a situation in which the volume of water in a tank is a function of time to its corresponding graph.

Graph 1

Graph 2

Graph 3

Graph 4

  1. An empty 20-gallon water tank is filled at a constant rate for 3 minutes until it is half full. Then, it is emptied at a constant rate for 3 minutes.

Correct! Graph 3

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 4.9.1–4.9.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Graph 3.

  1. A full 10-gallon water tank is drained for 30 seconds, until it is half full. Afterward, it gets refilled.

Correct! Graph 1

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 4.9.1–4.9.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Graph 1.

  1. A 2,000-gallon water tank starts out empty. It is being filled for 5 hours, slowly at first, and faster later.

Correct! Graph 2

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 4.9.1–4.9.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Graph 2.

  1. An empty 100-gallon water tank is filled in 50 minutes. Then, a dog jumps in and splashes around for 10 minutes, letting 7 gallons of water out. The tank is refilled afterward.

Correct! Graph 4

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 4.9.1–4.9.4 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is Graph 4.


For questions 6–7, use this situation and function:
The daily cost to the manufacturing company is modeled by the function \(C(x)=7.25x+2500\), where \(C(x)\) is the total daily cost and \(x\) is the number of items manufactured.

  1. What is \(C(0)\)? .

Correct! 2500

Try again. Why don’t you go back to activities 4.9.1–4.9.5 to test your understanding? Then come back and try this question again.

The correct answer is 2,500.

  1. What does C(0) mean in the context of the situation?

Correct! Cost before any items are manufactured

Try again. Take a moment to think about what you learned in activities 4.9.1–4.9.5. Are you using it the right way?

The correct answer is cost before any items are manufactured.
